pages.text: Crumillospongia Comes from the Middle Cambrian, with fossils found in the Burgess Shale, Canada and Murero Lagerst√§tte, Spain. It is bag-like sponge with a large opening at its top, and could grow up to 15 cm in overall size. The generic name derives from the Latin words 'crumilla', to mean 'money purse'; and 'spongia', to mean 'sponge.
